gov.usgs.cwbquery

Class EdgeQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.cwbquery.EdgeQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MiniSeedOutputHandler

    public final class EdgeQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements MiniSeedOutputHandler
    This class is a descendant of EdgeQuery but it works differently. When building a matches of IndexFileReplicators on its indices matches for a given julian day range, it uses the QueryFilesThread class to find the files for each julian day. It then opens those files using the IndexFileReplicator method and adds those now open files for days of interest to the indices (this is done in the "setParamters() method. The actually query for directories or data is then done through other methods. Data Query : the EdgeQueryThread2 which owns this object sets up the file matches with setParameters() and then uses getMatches() to get a channel matches. If the user uses the -delaz switches, then the EdgeQueryThread2 calls the setDelaz() method before asking for data so that only data within the delaz requests is returned. It then calls the query() method on all of the matches3 to get the data blocks. Directories : The EdgeQueryThread2 calls this object setParameters() to build the file matches. It then calls either queryDirector() to get a matches of file names, or getChannels() to get the channel summary (-lsc). DeleteData : this type of query returns the DeleteBlockInfo array for all of the blocks that match the query. It will return the information if the block is to be marked deleted or has already been deleted but lies in the interval; See getMatches() for a description of how channel masks, excludes file and delaz limits work.

      • setDelaz

        public void setDelaz(java.lang.String ss,
                     java.lang.String beg,
                     java.lang.String seedname)
        QueryThread calls this to create a delaz ring on donut of channels that are permitted to be returned.The matches built here is used by the query() methods to include only data which is on this matches.
        Parameters:
        ss - The delazc arguments for the metadata server ([mindeg:]maxdeg:lat:long)
        beg - The begin time for the -delazc (the day the matches is desired for)
        seedname - The seedname RE for a delazc command

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(java.util.Date beg,
                          java.util.Date end,
                          boolean d,
                          java.lang.String exclude,
                          boolean gaps,
                          java.lang.String tg,
                          boolean lsc,
                          boolean del)
        This routine originated when the EdgeQuery class was made reusable over the EdgeQuery class.In the original class the matches of files was built when an EdgeQuery object was created. Now, the indices to files is built when this function is called against the reusable EdgeQuery class Its primary function is to open all files for all julian days between beg and end inclusive. It also set other query parameters like whether this is a "gaps only" request or "lsc" type.
        Parameters:
        beg - Date of beginning of query
        end - Date at end of query
        d - Debug flag
        exclude - Filename on PATH[0] to find excludes
        gaps - If true, this is a gap only scan, and the headers only will be returned
        tg - The logging tag for this query
        lsc - If true, run an LSC command - if so, the data stored in the indices is really the names of the files and the files are not opened.
        del - If true, deletes are allowed.

      • queryMatches

        public int queryMatches(java.lang.String seedmask,
                        java.util.Date start,
                        double duration,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> matches)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        return a matches of seedname strings with match the seedmask, If excludes are set they are excluded from the matches. List is returned in sorted order and without any duplicates.
        Parameters:
        seedmask - A regexp name which will be used to match against the full matches of available
        start - The starting time of the query as a Date
        duration - The time of the query in seconds
        matches - The matching seednames
        Returns:
        Array of Strings with channel matches3.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one is encountered

      • queryMatches

        public int queryMatches(java.lang.String seedmask,
                        java.util.Date start,
                        java.util.Date end,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> matches)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        return a matches of seedname strings with match the seedmask. If excludes are set they are excluded from the matches. List is returned in sorted order and without any duplicates.
        Parameters:
        seedmask - A regexp name which will be used to match against the full matches of available
        start - The starting time of the query as a Date
        end - The end time of the query as a Date
        matches - Return the list of channels here
        Returns:
        An array of string with the channel matches3
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one is encountered

      • query

        public void query(java.lang.String seedname,
                  java.util.Date start,
                  double duration,
                  java.io.OutputStream out,
                  boolean nice,
                  boolean deleteBlock)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  IllegalSeednameException
        Query the edge files for all the records for a certain SEED name over a time period. The algorithm works like this: For every day in the date range, open the corresponding IndexFile(s). Get a matches of all the IndexBlocks for seedName. Get a matches of extents for each IndexBlock. For every extent that overlaps the date range, get a bitmap of data records. Finally, add every data record that overlaps the date range to the result matches.
        Parameters:
        seedname - the SEED name
        start - the beginning of the time period
        duration - The length to return in seconds.
        out - The output stream on which to output the data
        nice - If true, slow things down a bit
        deleteBlock - if true, delete this block
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one is thrown
        IllegalSeednameException - if one is thrown
